modules.moduleDescription: Introduction to the fundamentals of algebra, focusing on understanding variables, simple equations, and basic operations with integers and rational numbers.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Introduce students to the concept of variables as placeholders for numbers.
Teach students how to create and interpret algebraic expressions.
Enable students to convert verbal statements into algebraic equations.
Review addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of integers.
Introduce rational numbers and explain their properties.

lessons.lessonName: Adding, Subtracting, Multiplying, and Dividing Fractions and Decimals
lessons.lessonObjectives: Practice arithmetic operations with fractions and decimals.
Teach students to simplify algebraic expressions by combining like terms.
Introduce and apply the distributive property in simplifying expressions.
Apply fraction operations in algebraic expressions.
Teach students how to solve one-step equations involving addition or subtraction.
Teach students how to solve one-step equations involving multiplication or division.

lessons.lessonName: Solving Equations with Decimals and Fractions
lessons.lessonObjectives: Solve equations that include decimals and fractions.

modules.moduleDescription: Introduces complex concepts such as inequalities, coordinate systems, and basic geometry integration with algebra.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Teach students how to solve and graph inequalities.

lessons.lessonName: Graphing Inequalities on a Number Line
lessons.lessonObjectives: Demonstrate how to graph inequalities on a number line.
Solve and graph two-step inequalities.
Introduce the coordinate plane and basic graphing techniques.

lessons.lessonName: Plotting Points and Graphing Linear Equations
lessons.lessonObjectives: Practice plotting points and graphing simple linear equations.

lessons.lessonName: Finding Patterns in Tables and Graphs
lessons.lessonObjectives: Identify and analyze patterns in tables and graphs.
Introduce ratios and proportions and their applications.
Solve proportion equations.

lessons.lessonName: Converting Between Fractions, Decimals, and Percentages
lessons.lessonObjectives: Teach conversions between fractions, decimals, and percentages.

lessons.lessonName: Perimeter and Area of Algebraic Shapes
lessons.lessonObjectives: Use algebra to find the perimeter and area of shapes.

lessons.lessonName: Using Algebra to Solve Geometry Problems
lessons.lessonObjectives: Apply algebraic skills to solve geometric problems.

lessons.lessonName: Introduction to Surface Area and Volume
lessons.lessonObjectives: Introduce concepts of surface area and volume using algebra.

modules.moduleDescription: Explore deeper algebraic concepts such as multi-step equations, functions, and systems of equations.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Teach students to solve two-step equations.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to Two-Step Equations
lessonContent.description: Define two-step equations and provide basic examples.

lessonContent.title: Simplifying Equations with Addition/Subtraction
lessonContent.description: Focus on equations that only require one addition/subtraction step.

lessonContent.title: Simplifying Equations with Multiplication/Division
lessonContent.description: Transition to equations that require one multiplication/division step.

lessonContent.title: Combining Both Steps
lessonContent.description: Demonstrate solving equations with both steps sequentially.

lessonContent.title: Solving with Fractions
lessonContent.description: Introduce equations involving fractions and demonstrate simplification.

lessonContent.title: Solving with Decimals
lessonContent.description: Work through examples with decimal coefficients and solutions.

lessonContent.title: Word Problems
lessonContent.description: Apply two-step equations to solve real-world problems.

lessonContent.title: Error Analysis
lessonContent.description: Have students identify and correct mistakes in sample problems.

lessonContent.title: Practice with Increasing Complexity
lessonContent.description: Mixed problems that integrate both simple and challenging equations.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Test understanding and provide feedback.

lessons.lessonName: Equations with Variables on Both Sides
lessons.lessonObjectives: Solve equations with variables on both sides.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to Variables on Both Sides
lessonContent.description: Explain the concept and provide basic examples.

lessonContent.title: Simplifying Equations
lessonContent.description: Demonstrate how to simplify by combining like terms on each side.

lessonContent.title: Isolating the Variable
lessonContent.description: Practice moving variables to one side and constants to the other.

lessonContent.title: Using Inverse Operations
lessonContent.description: Reinforce using inverse operations to solve equations.

lessonContent.title: Solving with Fractions
lessonContent.description: Introduce equations with variables on both sides involving fractions.

lessonContent.title: Solving with Decimals
lessonContent.description: Transition to equations with decimal values.

lessonContent.title: Application in Word Problems
lessonContent.description: Apply equations with variables on both sides to solve real-world scenarios.

lessonContent.title: Error Analysis
lessonContent.description: Have students identify mistakes and explain how to correct them.

lessonContent.title: Complex Equations
lessonContent.description: Introduce more challenging equations with additional terms.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Evaluate student progress and understanding.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Apply the distributive property in equations.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to the Distributive Property
lessonContent.description: Explain the property and show simple examples.

lessonContent.title: Applying the Distributive Property
lessonContent.description: Solve equations using the distributive property with whole numbers.

lessonContent.title: Distributive Property with Fractions
lessonContent.description: Expand into equations involving fractions.

lessonContent.title: Distributive Property with Variables
lessonContent.description: Include equations where the property is applied to variables.

lessonContent.title: Combining Like Terms
lessonContent.description: Combine the distributive property with the simplification of like terms.

lessonContent.title: Multiple Applications in One Equation
lessonContent.description: Solve equations that require multiple uses of the distributive property.

lessonContent.title: Distributive Property in Word Problems
lessonContent.description: Translate real-world problems into equations requiring the distributive property.

lessonContent.title: Error Analysis
lessonContent.description: Identify and correct errors related to misapplication of the property.

lessonContent.title: Advanced Equations
lessonContent.description: Introduce equations with multiple terms and levels of difficulty.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Test understanding and consolidate knowledge.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Introduce functions and relations.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to Functions and Relations
lessonContent.description: Define and differentiate between functions and relations.

lessonContent.title: Mapping and Domain/Range
lessonContent.description: Teach students how to map relations and identify domain and range.

lessonContent.title: Identifying Functions
lessonContent.description: Demonstrate how to determine if a relation is a function using the vertical line test.

lessonContent.title: Function Notation Basics
lessonContent.description: Introduce function notation and its meaning.

lessonContent.title: Evaluating Functions
lessonContent.description: Practice evaluating functions for specific inputs.

lessonContent.title: Graphing Simple Functions
lessonContent.description: Start graphing basic linear functions.

lessonContent.title: Interpreting Graphs
lessonContent.description: Analyze function graphs to understand relationships.

lessonContent.title: Word Problems with Functions
lessonContent.description: Apply functions in context through word problems.

lessonContent.title: Advanced Function Concepts
lessonContent.description: Explore more complex examples, such as piecewise functions.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Review the concepts and check for understanding.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Teach students how to read and use function notation.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to Function Notation
lessonContent.description: Define and explain function notation.

lessonContent.title: Reading Function Notation
lessonContent.description: Practice interpreting and reading functions given in notation form.

lessonContent.title: Evaluating Functions from Notation
lessonContent.description: Work on substituting values into function notation.

lessonContent.title: Writing Functions Using Notation
lessonContent.description: Transition to writing simple equations using function notation.

lessonContent.title: Function Notation and Graphing
lessonContent.description: Connect notation with graphing linear functions.

lessonContent.title: Real-World Applications
lessonContent.description: Use function notation in context-based problems.

lessonContent.title: Function Operations
lessonContent.description: Introduce operations on functions, like addition and multiplication.

lessonContent.title: Inverse Functions
lessonContent.description: Explore inverse functions and how to write them in notation form.

lessonContent.title: Advanced Evaluations
lessonContent.description: Evaluate complex functions involving fractions or multiple terms.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Check understanding with quizzes and activities.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Evaluate and graph linear functions.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to Linear Functions
lessonContent.description: Define linear functions and introduce the standard form ( y = mx + b ).

lessonContent.title: Slope and Y-Intercept
lessonContent.description: Explain the concepts of slope and y-intercept, and how they relate to the linear equation.

lessonContent.title: Evaluating Linear Functions
lessonContent.description: Practice evaluating linear functions by substituting specific values for ( x ).

lessonContent.title: Graphing Linear Functions from a Table
lessonContent.description: Teach students to create a table of values and use it to plot points and graph a linear function.

lessonContent.title: Graphing Using Slope and Y-Intercept
lessonContent.description: Introduce the method of graphing linear equations directly using the slope and y-intercept.

lessonContent.title: Interpreting Graphs of Linear Functions
lessonContent.description: Analyze graphs to interpret the meaning of slope and y-intercept in real-world contexts.

lessonContent.title: Graphing Horizontal and Vertical Lines
lessonContent.description: Show how to graph equations where ( y ) or ( x ) is constant (horizontal and vertical lines).

lessonContent.title: Writing Equations from Graphs
lessonContent.description: Practice writing equations of linear functions given a graph.

lessonContent.title: Graphing Linear Inequalities
lessonContent.description: Introduce linear inequalities and how to graph them with shading the solution area.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Review graphing methods and evaluating functions through quizzes and practice problems.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Solve systems of equations by graphing.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to Systems of Equations
lessonContent.description: Define systems of equations and what it means to find a solution.

lessonContent.title: Graphing Two Linear Equations
lessonContent.description: Practice graphing two linear equations on the same coordinate plane.

lessonContent.title: Identifying Points of Intersection
lessonContent.description: Teach students how to identify the point of intersection as the solution to the system.

lessonContent.title: Consistent and Inconsistent Systems
lessonContent.description: Differentiate between systems with one solution, no solution (parallel lines), or infinitely many solutions (coincident lines).

lessonContent.title: Systems in Word Problems
lessonContent.description: Set up and solve systems of equations from word problems, interpreting the solution.

lessonContent.title: Graphing Systems with Fractions and Decimals
lessonContent.description: Graph more complex systems involving fractional or decimal coefficients.

lessonContent.title: Checking Solutions Algebraically
lessonContent.description: Verify the solution found from graphing by substituting values into both equations.

lessonContent.title: Graphing and Interpreting Systems of Inequalities
lessonContent.description: Extend to graphing systems of inequalities and finding solution regions.

lessonContent.title: Real-World Applications of Systems
lessonContent.description: Solve real-world problems using systems of equations involving rates, costs, etc.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Summative review of graphing systems with practice exercises and quizzes.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Solve systems using the substitution method.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to the Substitution Method
lessonContent.description: Explain the substitution method and when it is most effective.

lessonContent.title: Setting Up Equations for Substitution
lessonContent.description: Teach students to isolate one variable in an equation to prepare for substitution.

lessonContent.title: Substituting into the Second Equation
lessonContent.description: Practice substituting the expression from the first equation into the second equation.

lessonContent.title: Solving for the Remaining Variable
lessonContent.description: Solve the resulting single-variable equation.

lessonContent.title: Back Substitution
lessonContent.description: Substitute the solution back into the original equation to find the second variable’s value.

lessonContent.title: Checking Solutions
lessonContent.description: Practice verifying solutions by substituting values back into both original equations.

lessonContent.title: Solving Systems with Fractions
lessonContent.description: Work on systems involving fractional coefficients and constants.

lessonContent.title: Word Problems with Substitution
lessonContent.description: Apply the substitution method to solve word problems that model real-world scenarios.

lessonContent.title: Special Cases: No Solution or Infinite Solutions
lessonContent.description: Explore what happens when equations have no solution (parallel lines) or infinite solutions (same line).

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Review and assess students’ proficiency in solving systems using substitution through a quiz and problem set.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Solve systems using the elimination method.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to the Elimination Method
lessonContent.description: Define the elimination method and how it differs from substitution.

lessonContent.title: Aligning Equations for Elimination
lessonContent.description: Teach students how to align equations and look for terms that can be added or subtracted to eliminate a variable.

lessonContent.title: Adding and Subtracting Equations
lessonContent.description: Practice eliminating a variable by adding or subtracting equations directly.

lessonContent.title: Multiplying to Create Opposite Coefficients
lessonContent.description: Show how to multiply equations by constants to create opposite coefficients for one of the variables.

lessonContent.title: Solving the Resulting Equation
lessonContent.description: Solve the resulting single-variable equation after elimination.

lessonContent.title: Back Substitution in Elimination
lessonContent.description: Substitute the found value back into one of the original equations to solve for the remaining variable.

lessonContent.title: Elimination with Fractions and Decimals
lessonContent.description: Work through examples where equations involve fractions or decimal coefficients.

lessonContent.title: Word Problems Using Elimination
lessonContent.description: Solve systems of equations derived from word problems using the elimination method.

lessonContent.title: Special Cases: No Solution or Infinite Solutions
lessonContent.description: Identify and understand systems with no solution (parallel lines) or infinite solutions (identical equations).

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Conduct a quiz and practice exercises to review and assess understanding of the elimination method.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Introduce the laws of exponents.

lessonContent.title: Introduction to Exponents
lessonContent.description: Review what exponents are and discuss the concept of repeated multiplication.

lessonContent.title: Product of Powers Rule
lessonContent.description: Teach the rule for multiplying powers with the same base (e.g., (a^m cdot a^n = a^{m+n})).

lessonContent.title: Quotient of Powers Rule
lessonContent.description: Explain the rule for dividing powers with the same base (e.g., (a^m / a^n = a^{m-n})).

lessonContent.title: Power of a Power Rule
lessonContent.description: Practice raising a power to another power (e.g., ((a^m)^n = a^{mn})).

lessonContent.title: Power of a Product Rule
lessonContent.description: Apply the power of a product rule (e.g., ((ab)^n = a^n cdot b^n)).

lessonContent.title: Power of a Quotient Rule
lessonContent.description: Work with the power of a quotient rule (e.g., ((a/b)^n = a^n / b^n)).

lessonContent.title: Zero Exponent Rule
lessonContent.description: Introduce the concept that any base raised to the power of zero equals one (e.g., (a^0 = 1)).

lessonContent.title: Negative Exponents
lessonContent.description: Explain negative exponents and how they relate to reciprocals (e.g., (a^{-n} = 1/a^n)).

lessonContent.title: Combining Multiple Rules
lessonContent.description: Practice problems that combine several exponent rules in one expression to simplify.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Review through a quiz and problem set focusing on applying exponent laws to simplify expressions.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Simplify algebraic expressions using exponent rules.

lessonContent.title: Review of Exponent Rules
lessonContent.description: Briefly revisit the laws of exponents learned in Lesson 10.

lessonContent.title: Simplifying Basic Expressions
lessonContent.description: Practice simplifying simple expressions using a single exponent rule.

lessonContent.title: Simplifying Expressions with Multiple Terms
lessonContent.description: Introduce expressions involving several terms and apply multiple exponent rules.

lessonContent.title: Distributive Property with Exponents
lessonContent.description: Use the distributive property with exponents when simplifying expressions like (a(bc)^n).

lessonContent.title: Combining Like Terms with Exponents
lessonContent.description: Identify and combine like terms in expressions involving exponents.

lessonContent.title: Exponents in Fractions
lessonContent.description: Practice simplifying expressions with exponents in the numerator and denominator.

lessonContent.title: Working with Negative Exponents in Expressions
lessonContent.description: Apply rules for negative exponents within more complex algebraic expressions.

lessonContent.title: Simplifying Expressions with Variables and Exponents
lessonContent.description: Solve problems that combine variables with exponents, such as (x^m cdot y^n).

lessonContent.title: Applying Exponent Rules to Real-World Problems
lessonContent.description: Simplify expressions based on real-world contexts, like physics formulas or growth models.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Conduct a quiz and problem set focusing on simplifying increasingly complex expressions using exponent rules.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Introduce basic polynomial operations.

lessonContent.title: What are Polynomials?
lessonContent.description: Define polynomials and introduce terminology such as terms, coefficients, degree, and constants.

lessonContent.title: Identifying Degrees and Terms
lessonContent.description: Teach how to identify the degree of a polynomial and the number of terms (e.g., monomials, binomials, trinomials).

lessonContent.title: Adding Polynomials
lessonContent.description: Practice adding polynomials by combining like terms.

lessonContent.title: Subtracting Polynomials
lessonContent.description: Demonstrate subtracting polynomials, focusing on distributing negative signs and combining like terms.

lessonContent.title: Multiplying Polynomials (Monomial by Polynomial)
lessonContent.description: Show how to multiply a monomial by a polynomial using the distributive property.

lessonContent.title: Multiplying Polynomials (Binomial by Binomial)
lessonContent.description: Practice binomial multiplication (e.g., using the FOIL method).

lessonContent.title: Special Products of Polynomials
lessonContent.description: Explore patterns like the square of a binomial and the product of a sum and difference (e.g., ((a+b)^2) and ((a+b)(a-b))).

lessonContent.title: Identifying the Degree of a Product
lessonContent.description: Teach students how to determine the degree of a product when polynomials are multiplied.

lessonContent.title: Simplifying Polynomials
lessonContent.description: Practice simplifying polynomial expressions by combining like terms and using multiplication rules.

lessonContent.title: Assessment & Review
lessonContent.description: Conduct a quiz and practice exercises to review and assess understanding of basic polynomial operations.

modules.moduleDescription: Focus on advanced algebra concepts, including quadratics, inequalities in two variables, and radicals.

lessons.lessonObjectives: Introduce quadratic equations and their properties.
Solve quadratic equations using factoring.
Graph quadratic functions and understand their properties.

lessons.lessonName: Solving and Graphing Linear Inequalities in Two Variables
lessons.lessonObjectives: Solve and graph linear inequalities in two variables.
Solve and graph systems of inequalities.
Apply inequalities to real-world scenarios.
Simplify and evaluate square roots.
Perform operations with radical expressions.
Solve equations involving square roots.
Review all learned algebra concepts cumulatively.
Apply algebraic knowledge to solve real-world problems.
Prepare students for further advanced algebra with challenging problems.
